alert.note: Alert for La Crosse (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 10:28PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of La Crosse County through 1100 PM CDT... At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Onalaska, or near La Crosse, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bangor around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include County Roads G And H, Irish Hill, North Side Of La Crosse, South Side Of La Crosse, Goose Island, Stevenstown, Highways 14 61 And County M M, Rockland, County Roads D E And E and Blue Bird Campground. People attending Maple Grove Venues , and Dash Park in Onalaska should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Wisconsin. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
